main event: Two objects, one black and one orange, were observed in the sky over Hale, Michigan on November 11, 1964.
interesting points: The orange object appeared to break away from the black object.
The orange object had a tail or flame-like appearance, about the size of a pin.
The objects were observed for 2-8 seconds and then lost behind trees.
There were no local military aircraft flying at the time of the sighting, and weather phenomena were ruled out as the cause.
The intelligence officer was unable to arrive at any positive conclusions about the identity of the objects.
sighted object: two objects, one black and one orange
witnesses: Marie R. Thornty, school teacher, and Eugene L. Thornton, Captain in the 442nd FIS
